BE8044D72CF6452BAB001FE30101301D.description:
identify formal and informal
ways in which language and
image are used appropriately to
honour people and to celebrate
events

896A5E3D1416433E8D8AAC5A09162C0F.description: use language and image to honour own and others’ accomplishments

AF0C0B5A25F744C594351D44DEAADA68.description:
identify the underlying
assumptions reflected in the
ideas and opinions presented in a
text

C198B6BD5F504982A2BDAFF548E0288F.description:
describe the ways in which
selected works of literature and
other print and nonprint texts
influence individual and group
values and behaviours

B9C19D1414CD4EF1BBCA2F4022B0B8B0.description:
appreciate diversity of thought and expression, select and monitor appropriate strategies for appreciating
diversity, and modify selected strategies as needed

8863772A0DC64DF3BAC3C4A4C23C27A7.description: Appreciate diversity of expression, opinion and perspective

93F02158AE824D0B93015501836AA2D3.description:
differentiate between
constructive criticism and
ridicule, and between irony and
sarcasm

E887A9FE3B8746DB9DF3A33DEDA16F4A.description:
analyze and describe verbal and
nonverbal communication that
contributes to the inclusion or
exclusion of individuals involved
in a communication situation,
and use verbal and nonverbal
communication that is inclusive
of other individuals

440D12ADF0DE4B7BAB7797B025DDF94C.description:
analyze and describe positive or negative portrayals of characters in literature and persons in life, and be
sensitive to the feelings of others

6B05618FCEA14D3F8C40A838B294B959.description:
analyze and describe language
and images used in literature and
other texts to convey respectful
and considerate, or disrespectful
and inconsiderate, perspectives
and attitudes

61C4E6B575544C4884E2533F08729BFB.description:
monitor own use of verbal and nonverbal communication in order to convey respect and consideration, as
appropriate

769D68B3C2034CC7A503E3028C366386.description: Use language and image to show respect and consideration

BA32D9013AD7483EA703F2D7A8CE0C07.description: assess strengths and areas of need

9CF252BFB1A140A8B46A0267CA442AFD.description:
pay particular attention to punctuation, spelling, grammar, usage and sentence construction when using
unfamiliar vocabulary, complex syntax and sophisticated rhetorical devices

82507B8E53AB4508B522B9F9A252C8E5.description:
know and be able to use common
sentence structures correctly—
simple, compound, complex and
compound-complex

9477F450BA4B49A5BEF2A311A59A8353.description:
review and revise texts in
progress to correct common
sentence faults—comma splice,
run-on sentence and unintended
sentence fragment

6FB2DC8C5FAA40DB9EB5E047E9BDC25E.description:
identify parts of the sentence in
own and others’ texts, including
subject, verb, predicate
complement, and direct and
indirect object

661A18A45780471F93A287A5B0A6C412.description:
identify and be able to use parts
of speech correctly, including
nouns, pronouns, verbs,
adjectives, adverbs, prepositions,
definite and indefinite articles,
and coordinating and
subordinating conjunctions

10118372012E43078978CB2BA4654B55.description: know and be able to apply spelling conventions consistently and independently

284DE29F04B24A9DAA6F4899A59C47B8.description:
know and be able to apply capitalization and punctuation conventions correctly, including end punctuation,
commas, semicolons, colons, apostrophes, quotation marks, hyphens, dashes, ellipses, parentheses,
underlining and italics

F59962CEC2384CAAABBE0F99E7697C0D.description: use handbooks and other tools, including electronic tools, as resources to assist with text creation

2CEC8645511B418CB3498E8194DF88A5.description: Edit text for matters of correctness

707539B08A52447E99BC73D790B32F28.description:
recognize personal voice in texts created; and continue to develop
personal craft through practice, using various methods

4063052A57E5447EAB38C71B82EF627C.description:
describe the effects of own use
of stylistic techniques and
rhetorical devices

319F40321354495C98851112C57AB682.description:
use a variety of sentence patterns
and structures appropriately and
effectively

735358850EEB4E88907793D5E8A89C1C.description:
reflect on personal vocabulary and repertoire of stylistic choices and on their effectiveness; and expand
vocabulary and repertoire of stylistic choices

7308B0000F944484AB2E686DE8C11397.description: Consider and address matters of choice

BF037A927802414E9585BA29418185DF.description:
assess transitions and transitional devices, and revise them as needed to
strengthen coherence

AF85DF745FA54547A08F6D09A92BA2EE.description:
assess relationships among controlling idea, supporting ideas and
supporting details; and strengthen relationships as needed to enhance
the unity of texts

4D11728F38DC46EEBADC0A4983A4EB5F.description:
review the closing of a text in
progress, and revise it as needed
to strengthen its relationship to
purpose and to establish a sense
of developed understanding

0F236CDA1030417097CA85A2CB08F651.description:
review the organizational
components of a text in progress

AD7EF8AFDF85487AAC9FF99F50A3AFF4.description:
assess the beginning of a text in
progress, and revise it as needed
to establish purpose

074DEC7631BA49C78C19F55574A34124.description:
review own critical/analytical
response to literature for
plausibility, appropriateness of
interpretations, and precision,
completeness and relevance of
evidence; and revise
interpretations and evidence, as
necessary

D0101813724D4CD8BEEDE8BD1D5A3145.description:
review the accuracy, specificity
and precision of details, events,
images, facts or other data
intended to support a controlling
idea or to develop a unifying
effect; and add to details, events,
images, facts or other data as
needed to provide sufficient
support or development

E1EB198A47874A30AEF14ABD2D18269F.description:
review the controlling idea or
desired unifying effect of a text
in progress for clarity and focus, and modify
the controlling idea or desired
unifying effect as appropriate to
meet the intended purpose

28F1736A62884746BB98CBF022EDB20C.description: Enhance thought and understanding and support and detail

3F12F9D0C02E46F98B371115E2DDF4F7.description:
Improve thoughtfulness, effectiveness and correctness of
communication

E8522ED533B44453AFC71ECC6DBCC3FF.description:
experiment with various
strategies to create rapport
between the presenter and the
audience

CE4E9CC9BE3B407EA28D775BE53ECCF9.description:
develop and deliver oral, visual and multimedia presentations, using voice production factors, nonverbal factors and visual production
factors  appropriate to purpose, audience and situation

A0C499B136C1446B900E34B08E31F90B.description:
develop presentation materials;
and select strategies and
technologies appropriate to
purpose, audience and situation

F18B9C034D0D4E418613A2347769B2FB.description:
meet particular production, publication and display requirements for print texts; and explain requirements in light of purpose,
audience and situation

37E8AB2310BE434C8E771A8575541562.description:
Use production, publication and presentation strategies and technologies
consistent with context

DFF61F3E3F084D409A5D2DF751D42995.description:
incorporate effective examples from personal experience, concepts and ideas from exploration, and findings
from inquiry and research into created texts, when appropriate

BFF1279D62C9443A9041D497AA551245.description:
develop content appropriate to
audience and situation (form and context)

10BD9805768F4A298CA25632D9877330.description:
develop content to support a
controlling idea or to produce a
unifying effect

44EBD5A0E30C439C927D490C67C27668.description: develop supporting details, by using developmental aids appropriate to form and purpose

2B90DA526A8E48438D5A9B166BDE212B.description:
establish a focus for text creation, and communicate scope by framing an effective controlling idea or
describing a strong unifying effect

0E60BAB0B0C646109FB433B70BDB52AE.description:
take ownership of text creation, by selecting or crafting a topic, concept or idea that is personally
meaningful and engaging

5FBFB9C49D434C3B9977A7DFA52916D4.description:
understand the concept of convention; and apply it to oral, print, visual and multimedia text forms when
appropriate (30- depart from the conventions of
oral, print, visual and multimedia
texts, as appropriate to purpose,
audience and situation)

CD3DE7928B164584A09110DC97E14313.description:
explore the interplay among
medium, content and context;  select an effective medium
appropriate to content and
context, and explain its use

24995F6A42214DF4B51AF98FC0BC6436.description:
identify and use structures
consistent with form, content and
purpose when creating texts

44218894456A482591794D79EB736937.description:
select a text form appropriate to the purpose for text creation and consistent with the content to be presented
in the text

DC5FE29267784D0292881F688D4D0138.description: Consider and address form, structure and medium

66B21E21A89B47828ABC9E6D684CBB71.description:
describe expectations and
constraints of a communication
situation, including assignment
parameters, expected standards
of quality and availability of
resources; and select strategies to
address expectations and
constraints

26D59987E6334B1F9321E8E492923ED4.description:
describe and address audience
factors that affect text creation

4292466ED1344CB4BA8C1E2F95419DA4.description:
identify purpose and target audience for text creation, and select
strategies to accomplish purpose and engage audience

904DFA539259499FA308581C626DCA69.description:
reflect on the purposes for text creation, and
on own motives for selecting strategies to engage an audience; and consider potential consequences of choices regarding text
creation

24066E756BFA49B799E94C0CC3522243.description: Develop and present a variety of print and nonprint texts

997622D5211C4E0CB05C4771CEF9E019.description:
seek feedback from others and use own reflections to evaluate the entire inquiry or research process, strive for
craftsmanship and accuracy, and take pride in efforts and accomplishments

A0CD8994EDB54581B36223FE8B5DCAE8.description:
review the appropriateness, accuracy and significance of findings, conclusions and generalizations drawn from
gathered data and information; prepare a detailed record of references; determine how best to share the
information; and determine next steps, if any

A932AAAB6E5E4877B2B76A8946AD7728.description: identify strategies to improve future inquiry or research, and monitor the effectiveness of these strategies

BC8A9F3DFACF4B148C3B6EB4FEBBF3A0.description: reflect on and assess the effectiveness of strategies used to guide inquiry or research

4D12801F3F3246C3AA16DEE492D33B41.description: Review inquiry or research process and findings

D8A532CB9DAE4B3FB24B6155C2A83247.description:
distinguish between support and generalization, and provide support
for generalizations and conclusions

300FDF1FDD8E4FC7B6F1B646BC9F095D.description:
draw conclusions that are appropriate to findings, reflect own understandings and are consistent with the
identified topic, purpose and situation

01E2DD3CC8A342B9852C1AEEF16E469E.description:
form generalizations by integrating new information with prior
knowledge

87DAEA863E944418B32816F80BB529A4.description:
identify and describe possible
biases of sources (describe
the possible effects of such
biases on the credibility of
information)

7D87EBAB61724C5FB7C6B4B7147D9841.description:
assess the accuracy, completeness, currency and relevance of information selected from sources; and assess
the appropriateness of the information for purpose

02CA000B382545E9AC35EC4ECBF28CB1.description: assess information sources for appropriateness to purpose, audience and presentation form

E8FAD72717E146E9B8CFC938B14B949C.description:
reflect on and describe strategies to evaluate information sources for credibility and bias and for quality;
and select, monitor and modify strategies as needed to evaluate sources and detect bias

894A5AE3F1024958A5EECAC195CD3D99.description: record information accurately and completely; and document and reference sources, as appropriate

A749574A66A44AEAA2F71F63EEF3CB51.description: select information and other material appropriate to purpose from a variety of print and nonprint sources

807F3E04BFCF4BF083EDE45EAB752560.description:
reflect on and describe strategies that may be used to select, record and organize information; select and
monitor appropriate strategies; and modify selected strategies as needed

45E27377730449F48F02BAA96A99320D.description:
identify and select potential strategies and technologies for gathering,
generating and recording information

CB5E012C9C134771B500DD8B0D0B3AA6.description:
identify information sources
intended to fill gaps between
prior knowledge and required
information

7DDB695DA9A2421AA1432F3E4B748A99.description:
determine the breadth and depth
of prior knowledge, and
formulate questions to determine
information needs and to guide
the collection of required
information

639867CEB98644E197A780372E130B17.description:
develop an appropriate inquiry or
research plan that will address
the topic and satisfy contextual
requirements—purpose,
audience and situation—and
requirements of presentation
form

ED69240665E14396AD7E9AB49A8FA1DF.description:
reflect on and describe strategies for developing an inquiry or research plan that will foster understanding,
select and monitor appropriate strategies, and modify strategies as needed to plan inquiry or research
effectively

BE8DBACF508C482785DC9665F3AB54B5.description: Plan inquiry or research, and identify information needs and sources

3D7636BD99D94F30B39280F4EA3B381C.description: refine the purpose of inquiry or research by limiting or expanding the topic as appropriate

8C0A8234F7544C3882CF5A70FF5143F2.description:
describe the purpose of inquiry or research and the scope of the inquiry or research topic; identify the target
audience; and identify the potential form for the presentation of inquiry or research findings, when applicable

CBCDB5912E044146B50A64E9D9503EB4.description:
reflect on and describe
strategies to determine the
depth and breadth of inquiry
or research and to identify the
purpose, audience and
potential forms of presentation

09343340E3DB4CC2B5FDB158064198B7.description: Focus on purpose and presentation form

3D4C5021EBA84173A4A3F8F24DA36C56.description: describe the effectiveness of various texts, including media texts, for presenting feelings, ideas and infomration, and for evoking resonse

20F0979B619C492FBD3BCCDD3CF4DA22.description: use terminology appropriate to the forms studied for discussing and appreciating the effectiveness and artistry of a variety of text forms

FAD02473D77445619152F3FDE27A39AB.description: Appreciate the effectiveness and artistry of print and non-print texts

66DAB4150F5744A79AA030B40696C7BA.description: assess the significance of a text's theme or controlling idea, and the adequacy, relevance and effectiveness of its supporting details, examples or illustrations, and content in general

9B99ED0198B546DBBE517BC39EE731DD.description: describe images in print and non-print texts in terms of created reality and appropriateness to purpose

31C23384587A43C8A31BE887DF4AF40C.description: describe character and characterization in terms of consistency of behaviour, motivation and plausibility

19D25534105D4BCE94A27FD2B3EE7A65.description: describe setting and plots in terms of reality and plausibility, as appropriate

4A3324A863DD491A899A800D13EF63D4.description: assess the appropriateness of own and others' understandings and interpretations of works of literature and other texts, by referring to the works and texts for supporting or contradictory evidence

4A7153E78B4B473AAB6B66E6009ED3F3.description: identify criteria to evaluate the effectiveness of texts, monitor the effectiveness of the criteria, and modify the criteria as needed

56547790EF2C46DC9A0D32BD834D0834.description: Evaluate the verisimilitude, appropriateness and significance of print and non-print texts

A96F2CEA582044EC95030429DC25ABF8.description: identify and examine ways in which cultural and societal influences are reflected in a variety of Canadian and international texts

A9BD0E7928184F07A5D320460D92C7E3.description: compare choices and motives of characters and people portrayed in texts with choices and motives of self and others

FDC47257113A46E398D022E499FA2291.description: respond personally and analytically to ideas developed in works of literature and other texts; and analyze the ways in which ideas are reflected in personal and cultural opinions, values, beliefs and perspectives

D19F7EF1EB5141458A235E01D061955D.description: identify and consider personal, moral, ethical and cultural perspectives when studying literature and other texts; and reflect on and monitor how perspectives change as a result of interpretation and discussion

ABF0C8CA1E56450791BAD0378D1176DD.description: Connect self, text, culture and millieu

31CE8E0B496A4DE2811C63E79E62C7BC.description: Respond to a variety of print and nonprint texts

4F745D8E356B4EA5990AEEB4FB8AB5FF.description: identify persusive techiniques used in a variety of texts

23FE3A4CF32640C4873938EDD8693974.description: recognize the use of elements of effective oral, visual and multimedia presentations

669396135CE24D9FA1EAB9EFF9656BC3.description: recognize the use of motif and symbol

F40551D449C8488C8C39F99C27B1C6AF.description: describe the effects of musical devices, figures of speech and sensory details

65AF42373B1C4DD0A42749D5B15DCFD4.description: recognize irony and satire, and identify language used to create irony and satire

50B8914126D74BE18E0603309C094EB1.description: describe aspects of a text that contribute to atmosphere, tone and voice

49FE31BE48A44853B97043E4CDC2D67D.description: describe rhetorical devices and stylistic techniques that create clarity, coherence and emphasis

C671B955FC5141888AA0436ED9A672D8.description: Relate elements, devices and techniques to created effects

E9394A79E00346608BB75241327AE097.description: describe the characteristics of various common communications media

A80118EF7652477F9533495C610C62C0.description: describe a variety of organizational patterns and structural features that contribute to purpose and content

7ED1219000F34DFEAC211C7D20E414B0.description: describe audience factors that may have influenced a text creator's choice of form and medium

A51812B111F44C0D9FB85FAF24CD7A58.description: identify a variety of text forms, including communications forms and literary forms

4CB3798FFECA4FBF92878A8E2413E92F.description: Relate form, structure and medium to purpose, audience and content

5AD3E2BA76B248219F093A97E3C618E0.description: Understand and appreciate textual forms, elements and techniques

8F43085B458C4572A97EF1423138F5C8.description: create and use own reference materials to aid understanding

C811AB98CB3148898BA61070D980A0AC.description: use a variety of appropriate reference strategies and reference technologies to aid understanding

9DF24652D8DB4CB7B334CA3C2FAF4B8D.description: Use reference strateiges and reference technologies

6DFF3C10AA4D4A73900AC365209B932B.description: classify the genre/form of new texts according to attributes of genres/forms previously studied

86EAAB5F38AA4EE983D535798088E8D2.description: recall prior knowledge of rhetorical devices used in previously studied texts and textual elements and structures employed or deveolped to assist in understanding new texts

D82EA588B0FB4D099C554E67F66A20BA.description: describe personal expectations fro a text to be studied, by recalling prior experiences with and observations about similar contexts, content and text forms

E3D7DD9FEF954D5C8F6891477BC1A17F.description: reflect on and describe strategies used to engage prior knowledge as a means of assisting comprehension of new texts; and select, monitor and modify strategies as needed

83FBF066766347EF87B933223A26B1E5.description: differentiate between audience response content of a presentation and audience response to the performance of the presenter

4BAF7A0ABE9A49F890BADF139AF651C8.description: describe visual and aural elements and describe their contributions to the meaning of texts

814BC3A3AEF64DE8B537C340A44EC065.description: differentiate between literal and figurative statements, and between imagery and non-sensory language, identify symbol, recognize familiar allusions, and describe how images are developed in texts

D72B55A9D6EB402B803396DF89A46B22.description: describe a text creator's tone, and relate tone to purpose and audience

2C1E1D58AC3942FD917859FB0124169C.description: describe the personality traits, motivations, attitudes, values and relationships of characters developed/persons presented in literature and other texts; and identify how the use of archetypes adds to an appreciation of text

DC98B604E1F246D68384FF6BBD92925C.description: summarize the plot of a narrative, describe its setting and atmosphere, describe development of conflict, and identify theme

F088A327774340D58EE987C5CC9CA804.description: paraphrase a text's controlling idea, and identify supporting ideas and supporting details

CB5ACEC9A3EB491B928943E94EDD6194.description: use a variety of strategies to comprehend literature and other texts

338209F24DA0457B87591CB64CCE190A.description: describe the relationship between text and context

A830C0F9B7014B1482BF30B149AD2C48.description: use features of a text that provide information about the text

6C1E648C3E4749BD97295D741F271FA2.description: identify a variety of texts, audiences and purposes for creating texts

056D9857B4EA473793C11BDE707FE0E0.description: Construct meaning from text and context

9BC6F0DAC42B4DDAADA3F14B6570AAC3.description: Set personal goals for language growth

407D27FBE3DE46CE8261CC764DB6980C.description: Experiment with language, image and structure

ECD58ACE3ECF417E9A59C07592A05F3B.description: Form tentative understanding, interpretations and positions
